document_data.mainbody:
lamaerdown was a noble family from Athkatla in Amn.
By the late 14 century DR, Flamaerdowns were presumed extinct. The familys huge estate stood in the Temple District on Aundles Walk. Subsequently, the estate was repurposed into the Temple Bell, a shop that dealt in religious paraphernalia, holy symbols, and religious texts from numerous denominations.
